lessons.title: Setting Up Your Environment
lessons.description: Install Node.js, npm, and Angular CLI
lessons.content:
Prerequisites

Before starting with Angular, you need:

  • Node.js (v18 or higher)
  • npm (comes with Node.js)
  • A code editor (VS Code recommended)

Installation Steps

  1. Download and install Node.js from nodejs.org
  2. Verify installation: node --version
  3. Install Angular CLI: npm install -g @angular/cli
  4. Verify Angular CLI: ng version

sections.title: TypeScript Fundamentals
sections.description: Master TypeScript, the language behind Angular

lessons.title: Types and Interfaces
lessons.content:
Basic Types

TypeScript provides several basic types:

let name: string = 'Angular';
let version: number = 20;
let isActive: boolean = true;

Interfaces

Interfaces define the structure of objects:

interface User {
  id: number;
  name: string;
  email: string;
}

lessons.title: Component Templates
lessons.description: Work with component templates and data binding
lessons.content:
Template Syntax

Angular provides powerful template syntax:

<h1>{{ title }}</h1>
<button (click)="handleClick()">Click Me</button>
<input [(ngModel)]="userName">

quizzes.title: Getting Started Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your understanding of Angular basics

questions.question: What is Angular?
questions.explanation: Angular is a TypeScript-based web application framework developed by Google.

questions.question: Which command is used to create a new Angular project?
questions.explanation: The 'ng new' command is used with Angular CLI to create a new Angular project.

questions.question: TypeScript is required for Angular development.
questions.explanation: Yes, Angular is built with and requires TypeScript for development.

quizzes.title: Components Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Angular components

questions.question: What is a component in Angular?

options.text: A reusable piece of UI with logic and template

questions.explanation: A component is a TypeScript class with a template and styles that controls a part of the UI.

questions.question: What decorator is used to define a component?
questions.explanation: The @Component decorator is used to define an Angular component.
